docs.text: Linked Data for the Historic Environment (LD4HE) Project aims The LD4HE project has the following aims and objectives: To create a mapping from mandatory OASIS fields to the CIDOC-CRM. To create a simple means of converting an OASIS data export to a Linked Data compatible format. To determine criteria for establishing which records should be included in Linked Data export. To recommend potential for creation and usage of Linked Data. Project scope The LD4HE project scope is to create the capacity for mandatory OASIS metadata (see list of mandatory fields ) to be exported in a Linked Data compatible format.This is mapping and export only, with no intention (at this stage) to make the output data publicly available (thus not Linked Open Data). There are no current plans for hosting the output data within a publicly available triple store. The LD4HE project will allow questions such as the following examples to be answered accurately: How many reports have been produced with evidence of Roman archaeology from post-determinative excavation in Southwest England? How many research investigations occurred in England in a given year? How many geophysical surveys have been undertaken on a specific type of geology? How many reports are there which fit a specific theme within a research framework? Data model The data model to be used is based on a subset of the CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model (CRM) . The following pages give further details of distinct aspects of the LD4HE data model: Overall data model Dataset Record Investigation Organization Site Report Time Span Artefact Monument Person
docs.title: Home
Linked Data for the Historic Environment (LD4HE)

docs.text: The LD4HE project has the following aims and objectives: To create a mapping from mandatory OASIS fields to the CIDOC-CRM. To create a simple means of converting an OASIS data export to a Linked Data compatible format. To determine criteria for establishing which records should be included in Linked Data export. To recommend potential for creation and usage of Linked Data.
docs.title: Project aims

docs.text: The LD4HE project scope is to create the capacity for mandatory OASIS metadata (see list of mandatory fields ) to be exported in a Linked Data compatible format.This is mapping and export only, with no intention (at this stage) to make the output data publicly available (thus not Linked Open Data). There are no current plans for hosting the output data within a publicly available triple store. The LD4HE project will allow questions such as the following examples to be answered accurately: How many reports have been produced with evidence of Roman archaeology from post-determinative excavation in Southwest England? How many research investigations occurred in England in a given year? How many geophysical surveys have been undertaken on a specific type of geology? How many reports are there which fit a specific theme within a research framework?

docs.title: Dataset

docs.text: OASIS mandatory fields The source data for the LD4HE project comes from a specific subset of fields in the overall OASIS dataset. These are mandatory fields in the OASIS data input. Field ID Field Name Notes 1 oasis_id Unique identifier related to the OASIS record ) 2 event_type The type of investigation . URIs from FISH Event Types Thesaurus . There may be multiple event types per record 3 reason for investigation The reason for an investigation . URIs from OASIS Reason for Investigation 4 Country Location of a site . URIs from OS Open Names 5 Site name Free text name for a local site 9a Grid reference (geom_ngr) Location of a site . This will store either a point, line or polygon in a single geometry field (using PostGIS), using the OSGB36 crs. There can be multiple values per record. 9b Grid reference (geom_ll) Location of a site . This will store either a point, line or polygon in a single geometry field (using PostGIS), using the WGS84 crs. There can be multiple rows per record. 15 County Location of a site . URIs from OS Open Names 16 District Location of a site . URIs from OS Open Names 17 Parish Location of a site . URIs from OS Open Names 18 HER Auto generated 19 National body Auto generated 22 Project title Value generated in form 23a Start date Start of the overall timespan for an investigation . Value generated in form 23b End date End of the overall timespan for an investigation . Value generated in form 24a Methodology Techniques used in an investigation , URIs from FISH Event Types . There can be multiple values per record. 24b Description Free text 28 Planning application ID Free text, and only if prompt (id3) = commercial 31 Project codes Type of code - OASIS Associated ID 35 Publication type URIs from OASIS Paper and Digital Archive Component vocabulary 91 Type of report Report type. URIs from OASIS Paper and Digital Archive Component vocabulary 36 Title of report Report title. Auto generated through form 39 Author / editor Author / Editor of report . Potential at a future date to assign ISSN to authors via the ADS Library, but the methodology for sustaining this is still not firmly established. 44 Date year the report was published/issued 45 Publisher Organization publishing the report 46 Place of issue Place of publication for the report . Could use OS, but of limited use for this data 58 Name of organization Auto generated 50 URL URL of the report 50a DOI DOI of the report 62 Monument type URIs from monument type vocabulary corresponding to site location: England / Scotland / Wales 63 Monument period URIs from period vocabulary corresponding to site location: England / Scotland / Wales 64 Artefact type URIs from object types vocabulary according to site location: England & Wales / Scotland 65 Artefact period URIs from period vocabulary corresponding to site location: England / Scotland / Wales 70 Research outcomes Use selection from Research Frameworks list (non-LOD at time of writing) OASIS+ Solid geology If Geophysical module completed. Will use data from http://data.bgs.ac.uk/downloads.html OASIS+ Drift geology If Geophysical module completed. Will use data from http://data.bgs.ac.uk/downloads.html
docs.title: Data Fields
